Topic.Title: How to search for a called function?

Posts.EditableText:
This is idiotic, I know, but I have to ask it...

Near the end of X2, I have a function that is supposed to run that is called 'execution'.  For the life of me, I cannot find it in my mass of GUI junk or in code (and there is a LOT of it).  Is there a way to search for the script that calls the function 'execution'.  Or, is there a way to search for the script that unlocks a locked exit named 'commonlock'?

Thanks again!

XanMag
Posts.HTML:
This is idiotic, I know, but I have to ask it...

Near the end of X2, I have a function that is supposed to run that is called 'execution'. For the life of me, I cannot find it in my mass of GUI junk or in code (and there is a LOT of it). Is there a way to search for the script that calls the function 'execution'. Or, is there a way to search for the script that unlocks a locked exit named 'commonlock'?

Thanks again!

XanMag

Posts.EditableText: just open the file up in a text software (such as notepad++), and use its 'find' functionality
Posts.HTML: just open the file up in a text software (such as notepad++), and use its 'find' functionality

Posts.EditableText: Or go to Tools - Code view and use the search functionality there (press CTRL-F).
Posts.HTML: Or go to Tools - Code view and use the search functionality there (press CTRL-F).

Posts.EditableText:
Bingo!  That's a great feature to know about when you're dealing with a gigantic game!

Thanks again!
Posts.HTML:
Bingo! That's a great feature to know about when you're dealing with a gigantic game!

Thanks again!

Posts.EditableText: quest has a built-in search-find feature, awesome!
Posts.HTML: quest has a built-in search-find feature, awesome!
